00027 class ImageFormat_TarProxy: public FileFormat
00028 {
00029 private:
00030     struct {
00031         char name[100];
00032         char mode[8];
00033         char uid[8];
00034         char gid[8];
00035         char size[12];
00036         char mtime[12];
00037         char chksum[8];
00038         char typeflag;
00039         char linkname[100];
00040         char magic[6];
00041         char version[2];
00042         char uname[32];
00043         char gname[32];
00044         char devmajor[8];
00045         char devminor[8];
00046         char prefix[155];
00047         char padding[12];
00048     } tar_header;
00049     bool read_header( const boost::iostreams::filtering_istream &src, size_t &size, size_t &next_header_in ) {
00050         if( boost::iostreams::read( src, reinterpret_cast<char *>( &tar_header ), 512 ) == 512 ) {
00051             //get the size
00052             std::stringstream buff( tar_header.size );
00053             size = 0, next_header_in = 0;
00054 
00055             if( tar_header.size[10] != 0 ) {
00056                 buff >> std::oct >> size;
00057                 next_header_in = ( size / 512 ) * 512 + ( size % 512 ? 512 : 0 );
00058             }
00059 
00060             return true;
00061         } else
00062             return false;
00063     }
00064     static size_t tar_readstream( const boost::iostreams::filtering_istream &src, void *dst, size_t size, const std::string &log_title ) {
00065         size_t red = boost::iostreams::read( src, ( char * )dst, size ); // read data from the stream into the mapped memory
00066 
00067         if( red != size ) { // read the data from the stream
00068             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Could not read all " << size << " bytes for " << util::MSubject( log_title );
00069         }
00070 
00071         return red;
00072     }
00073 
00074 protected:
00075     std::string suffixes( io_modes modes = both )const {
00076         if( modes == write_only )
00077             return std::string();
00078         else
00079             return std::string( "tar tar.gz tgz tar.bz2 tbz tar.Z taz" );
00080     }
00081 public:
00082     std::string dialects( const std::string &/*filename*/ )const {
00083 
00084         std::list<util::istring> suffixes;
00085         BOOST_FOREACH( data::IOFactory::FileFormatPtr format, data::IOFactory::getFormats() ) {
00086             const std::list<util::istring> s = format->getSuffixes();
00087             suffixes.insert( suffixes.end(), s.begin(), s.end() );
00088         }
00089         suffixes.sort();
00090         suffixes.unique();
00091 
00092         return std::string( util::listToString( suffixes.begin(), suffixes.end(), " ", "", "" ) );
00093     }
00094     std::string getName()const {return "tar decompression proxy for other formats";}
00095 
00096     int load ( std::list<data::Chunk> &chunks, const std::string &filename, const std::string &dialect ) throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00097         int ret = 0;
00098 
00099         const util::istring suffix = makeBasename( filename ).second.c_str();
00100 
00101 
00102         // set up the input stream
00103         std::ifstream input( filename.c_str(), std::ios_base::binary );
00104         input.exceptions( std::ios::badbit );
00105         boost::iostreams::filtering_istream in;
00106 
00107         if( suffix == ".tar.gz" || suffix == ".tgz" )
00108             in.push( boost::iostreams::gzip_decompressor() );
00109         else if( suffix == ".tar.bz2" || suffix == ".tbz" )
00110             in.push( boost::iostreams::bzip2_decompressor() );
00111         else if( suffix == ".tar.Z" || suffix == ".taz" )
00112             in.push( boost::iostreams::zlib_decompressor() );
00113 
00114         in.push( input );
00115 
00116         size_t size, next_header_in;
00117 
00118         while( in.good() && read_header( in, size, next_header_in ) ) { //read the header block
00119 
00120             boost::filesystem::path org_file;
00121 
00122             if( tar_header.typeflag == 'L' ) { // the filename of the next file is to long - so its stored in the next block (following this header)
00123                 char namebuff[size];
00124                 next_header_in -= tar_readstream( in, namebuff, size, "overlong filename for next entry" );
00125                 in.ignore( next_header_in ); // skip the remaining input until the next header
00126                 org_file = boost::filesystem::path( namebuff );
00127                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Got overlong name " << util::MSubject( org_file.file_string() ) << " for next file.";
00128 
00129                 read_header( in, size, next_header_in ); //continue with the next header
00130             } else {
00131                 //get the original filename (use substr, because these fields are not \0-terminated)
00132                 org_file = boost::filesystem::path( std::string( tar_header.prefix ).substr( 0, 155 ) + std::string( tar_header.name ).substr( 0, 100 ) );
00133             }
00134 
00135             if( size == 0 ) //if there is no content skip this entry (there are allways two "empty" blocks at the end of a tar)
00136                 continue;
00137 
00138             if( tar_header.typeflag == '\0' || tar_header.typeflag == '0' ) { //only do regulars files
00139 
00140                 data::IOFactory::FileFormatList formats = data::IOFactory::getFileFormatList( org_file.file_string(), dialect ); // and get the reading pluging for that
00141 
00142                 if( formats.empty() ) {
00143                     LOG( Runtime, notice ) << "Skipping " << org_file << " from " << filename << " because no plugin was found to read it"; // skip if we found none
00144                 } else {
00145                     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Got " << org_file << " from " << filename << " there are " << formats.size() << " plugins which should be able to read it";
00146 
00147                     const std::pair<std::string, std::string> base = formats.front()->makeBasename( org_file.file_string() );//ask any of the plugins for the suffix
00148                     util::TmpFile tmpfile( "", base.second );//create a temporary file with this suffix
00149 
00150                     data::FilePtr mfile( tmpfile, size, true );
00151 
00152                     if( !mfile.good() ) {
00153                         throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Failed to open temporary " ) + tmpfile.file_string() );
00154                     }
00155 
00156                     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Mapped " << size << " bytes of " << mfile.getLength() << " at " << ( void * )&mfile[0];
00157 
00158                     size_t red = boost::iostreams::read( in, ( char * )&mfile[0], size ); // read data from the stream into the mapped memory
00159                     next_header_in -= red;
00160                     mfile.release(); //close and unmap the temporary file/mapped memory
00161 
00162                     if( red != size ) { // read the data from the stream
00163                         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Could not read all " << size << " bytes for " << tmpfile.file_string();
00164                     }
00165 
00166                     // read the temporary file
00167                     std::list<data::Chunk>::iterator prev = chunks.end();
00168                     --prev;
00169                     ret += data::IOFactory::load( chunks, tmpfile.string(), dialect );
00170 
00171                     for( ; prev != chunks.end(); ++prev ) { // set the source property of the red chunks to something more usefull
00172                         prev->setPropertyAs( "source", ( boost::filesystem::path( filename ) / org_file ).file_string() );
00173                     }
00174                 }
00175             } else {
00176                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Skipping " << org_file.file_string() << " because its no regular file (type is " << tar_header.typeflag << ")" ;
00177             }
00178 
00179             in.ignore( next_header_in ); // skip the remaining input until the next header
00180         }
00181 
00182         return ret;
00183     }
00184 
00185     void write( const data::Image &/*image*/, const std::string &/*filename*/, const std::string &/*dialect*/ )throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00186         throw( std::runtime_error( "Writing to tar is not (yet) implemented" ) );
00187     }
00188     bool tainted()const {return false;}//internal plugins are not tainted
00189 };
00190 }
00191 }
00192 isis::image_io::FileFormat *factory()
00193 {
00194     return new isis::image_io::ImageFormat_TarProxy();
